markov

Class MarkovChain<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • markov.Node<T>
      • markov.MarkovChain<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the elements that will be picked from.

    public class MarkovChain<T>
extends Node<T>
    Author:
    Alexander Johnston Copyright 2020 A class where a set of elements are picked from randomly to decide which element will be the output of fun() based on the last returned element.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MarkovChain(java.util.Set<T> set)
      Creates a MarkovChain where all the probabilities are equal.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • MarkovChain

        public MarkovChain(java.util.Set<T> set)
        Creates a MarkovChain where all the probabilities are equal. The elements in set will be added by reference.
        Parameters:
        set - as the set of elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the set is null or it contains a null element.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the set doesn't have more than one element.

    • Method Detail

      • getFirstLink

        public ProbFun<T> getFirstLink()
        Returns:
        the ProbFun that returns the first element when fun() is called.

      • getChain

        public java.util.Map<T,ProbFun<T>> getChain()
        Returns:
        the chain that makes up the Map from the output values of a ProbFun to probabilities or Nodes.

      • good

        public void good(T sourceElement,
                 T destinationElement,
                 double percent)
        Adjust the probabilities to make sourceElement more likely to return destinationElement when fun() is called.
        Parameters:
        sourceElement - as the source element in the MarkovChain which may be null to adjust the probability of the first returned element.
        destinationElement - as the destination element in the MarkovChain.
        percent - as the percentage, between 0 and 1 exclusive, of the probability of sourceElement returning destinationElement to add to the probability.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if destinationElement is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive.

      • bad

        public void bad(T sourceElement,
                T destinationElement,
                double percent)
        Adjust the probabilities to make sourceElement less likely to return destinationElement when fun() is called.
        Parameters:
        sourceElement - as the source element in the MarkovChain which may be null to adjust the probability of the first returned element.
        destinationElement - as the destination element in the MarkovChain.
        percent - as the percentage, between 0 and 1 exclusive, of the probability of sourceElement returning destinationElement to subtract from the probability.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if destinationElement is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive.

      • fun

        public T fun()
        Specified by:
        fun in class Node<T>
        Returns:
        a randomly picked element from this MarkovChain which is based on the previously returned element and past feedback. Any changes in the element will be reflected in this MarkovChain.

        public Node<T> clone()
        Specified by:
